message_text:
4. Resolve conflict peacefully
  
All adults have disagreements sometimes. But solving issues through fighting is not effective. Instead, if you start feeling angry, walk away for a bit or take a deep breath before responding in a calmer way.
Would you like to see a comic about resolving conflict peacefully?

Child: “Look, it is raining so much outside!”

Parent 1: “I am glad you brought in the laundry earlier, my dear. Otherwise, it would have been soaked by now!”

(2)

Parent 2: “I thought you said you would bring in the laundry today?”

Parent 1: “No, I was busy cooking dinner! You told me you would take care of it! How could you forget? Now all the laundry is wet!”

Parent 2: “I’m really sorry. It was a mistake!”

(3)

Parent 1 (thinking): I can’t believe he forgot! But everyone can make mistakes. Take a deep breath…

(4)

Parent 1: “I’m sorry if I sounded upset. I just got stressed because I have had a long day.”

Parent 2: “I am sorry that I forgot the laundry. I know you have had a long day. I will make sure to take care of it after dinner.”

(5)
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
